page.title: 02The Ash Ranges.
page.content: The land is owned by the M.O.D and is used by all units of the Regular Army on weekdays and by part-time and volunteer forces at the weekend. The normal times of use are 08.00 to 17.30 including two late nights of up to 23.30. All types of personal weapons are fired ranging from small-bore rifles to handheld mortars. At regular intervals during the year the firing ranges are used for prestigious International events and for National Championships. The Wyke Common towards the centre of the area is generally used for tank training although no weapons are fired. Manoeuvres of up to two weeks in duration and involving all branches of the Army are also carried out in this area. This however is fairly occasional use and the wildlife remains fairly undisturbed.
